forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
Since bootlace.com is part of grub4dos it is "queer" that you think it doesn't fit there. ![:dubbio:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/dubbio.gif)  

0.4.4 is NOT an EXACT enough version of grub4dos 0.4.4-2009-10-16 (example) is:  
<http://reboot.pro/14/>  
Try anyway with a more recent one:  
[http://code.google.c.../downloads/list](http://code.google.com/p/grub4dos-chenall/downloads/list "External link")  

You are most probably falling in THIS ![:unsure:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/unsure.png):  
<http://reboot.pro/8200/>  
issue.  
Though this is related to actual bootsector (and NOT MBR).  
It is possible that Windows 7 sees the 0x81 drive (just a guess, but maybe it is a uSB stick) as a superfloppy and it "protects" the first sector anyway.  

Try using lockdismount:  
<http://reboot.pro/12413/>  
before running bootlace.com  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)  
Wonko
